intro: Fagara duplicipunctata, commonly known as the two-spotted fagara, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory tree or shrub in humid, shaded forest environments. Its fruit is a small, round berry that contains several seeds, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife species.
